briefTitle: A Study of MabThera (Rituximab) in Elderly Patients With Untreated Follicular Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (NHL)

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Disease Progression or Death
outcomeMeasures.description: PFS from randomization was measured from the date of randomization to the date of documented disease progression, relapse, or death from any cause. PFS function was estimated using Kaplan-Meier product-limit method. Responding participants and participants who were lost to follow up were censored at their last assessment date.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Estimated to be Free of Progression at 12, 24, and 36 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: PFS from enrollment was measured from the date of enrollment to the date of disease progression, relapse, or death from any cause. Responding participants and participants who were lost to follow-up were censored at their last assessment date. Estimates of PFS function were made with the Kaplan-Meier product-limit method.

outcomeMeasures.title: Disease-Free Survival (DFS) From Randomization - Percentage of Participants Disease Free at 12, 24, and 36 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: DFS was defined for all participants who achieved a complete response (CR) or unconfirmed CR (CRu) at Month 3 or later, after the completion of induction phase and was measured from the time of randomization to the date of relapse or death as a result of lymphoma or acute toxicity of treatment. Participants without relapse were censored at their last assessment date. Estimates of DFS were made using Kaplan-Meier product-limit method.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival (OS) From Randomization - Percentage of Participants Estimated to be Alive at 12, 24, and 34 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: OS from randomization was defined as the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. Participants still alive at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact. Estimates of the OS function were made by the Kaplan-Meier product-limit method.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival (OS) From Randomization - Percentage of Participants With Death
outcomeMeasures.description: OS from randomization was defined as the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause. Participants still alive at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact. Estimates of the OS function were made by the Kaplan-Meier product-limit method.

outcomeMeasures.title: OS From Enrollment - Percentage of Participants Estimated to be Alive at 12, 24, and 36 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: OS from enrollment was defined as the date of enrollment to the date of death from any cause. Participants still alive at the time of the final analysis were censored at the date of the last contact. Estimates of the OS function were made by the Kaplan-Meier product-limit method.

outcomeMeasures.title: PFS Randomization- Percentage of Participants Estimated to be Free of Progression at 12, 24, and 34 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: PFS from randomization was measured from the date of randomization to the date of documented disease progression, relapse, or death from any cause. Responding participants and participants who were lost to follow-up were censored at their last assessment date. PFS was estimated using Kaplan-Meier methods.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With a Response During the Induction Phase
outcomeMeasures.description: Participants without a response assessment (due to any reasons) were considered as non-responders.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With a Molecular Response in the Induction Phase
outcomeMeasures.description: Molecular responders were defined as the proportion of CR/CRu participants with a positive bcl-2/IgH (non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma \[NHL\] marker) at baseline, whose laboratory values were undetectable after treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Duration of Response Using a Traditional Approach - Percentage of Participants Estimated to Have a Sustained Response at 12, 24, and 34 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: Duration of response (DOR) was defined for all participants who achieved a response (CR, CRu, and PR) at Month 3 or later, after the completion of induction phase and was measured from the date of randomization until the date of progression, relapse, or death as a result of follicular lymphoma (FL). Participants without relapse, progression, or death for causes other than FL were censored at their last assessment date. Analyses on this endpoint were performed with two different approaches. For the traditional approach, duration of response was estimated as the proportion of participants alive without progression or relapse of disease with the Kaplan-Meier method.

outcomeMeasures.title: Duration of Response Using the Competing Risk Approach - Cumulative Percentage of Participants With Progression, Relapse or Death as a Result of FL at 12, 24, and 34 Months
outcomeMeasures.description: DOR was defined for all participants who achieved a response (CR, CRu, and PR) at Month 3 or later, after the completion of induction phase and was measured from the date of randomization until the date of progression, relapse, or death as a result of FL. Participants without relapse, progression, or death for causes other than FL were censored at their last assessment date. Analyses on this endpoint were performed with two different approaches. For the competing risk approach, deaths for causes other than FL were considered as competing events. DOR was estimated with the cumulative incidence of progression, relapse, or death as a result of FL.
